title: João Paulo Sanches
text:
João Paulo Imbernom Sanches (born 14 August 1980), known as João Paulo Sanches, is a Brazilian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Coach%20%28sport%29">manager</a>. He is the current technical coordinator of <a href="Atl%C3%A9tico%20Clube%20Goianiense">Atlético Goianiense</a>.
Career.
Sanches' first experience as first team manager occurred in February 2015, after <a href="Marcelo%20Chamusca">Marcelo Chamusca</a>'s dismissal. He was in charge for two further spells during the year, replacing <a href="Jorginho%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201965%29">Jorginho</a> and <a href="Gilberto%20Pereira">Gilberto Pereira</a>.
Sanches returned to his assistant role in 2016, but was again appointed interim manager on 21 July 2017, replacing sacked <a href="Doriva">Doriva</a>. Despite failing to <a href="2017%20Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20A">avoid relegation</a> with the club, he was definitely named manager on 3 December.
Sanches went back to the assistant role after the appointment of <a href="Claudio%20Tencati">Claudio Tencati</a>, and subsequently had spells at <a href="Associa%C3%A7%C3%A3o%20Atl%C3%A9tica%20Ponte%20Preta">Ponte Preta</a> (as an assistant) and <a href="Associa%C3%A7%C3%A3o%20Atl%C3%A9tica%20Aparecidense">Aparecidense</a> (as a manager) before returning to "Dragão" in 2020, as a technical coordinator. On 3 March 2021, after both manager <a href="Marcelo%20Cabo">Marcelo Cabo</a> and permanent assistant manager <a href="Eduardo%20do%20Nascimento%20Souza">Eduardo Souza</a> left the club, he was named interim manager for the start of the campaign.
